message: Since there is no way that Python Atlanta is going to try to have a regular meeting with presentations the night before the main Python conference starts :-) we would like to use our monthly room reservation at Manuel's Tavern this coming Thursday night (March 10th) to have dinner and drinks with anyone from PyCon who would like to join us!  I can carry about 7 other people in my vehicle and I will be driving over to the Tavern from the conference hotel following the afternoon tutorials. Who wants a ride, and who with a vehicle at the conference might want to drive as well?
I'll be there :)   I can fit a few people in my car and driving from Marietta, so if anyone needs me to swing by the hotel on the way I can.

(For the sake of clarity: Python Atlanta has no budget and is not offering to pay for anyone's food or drink; we are just offering the free venue that we reserve each month as a wonderful local place — Manuel's Tavern is one of Atlanta's oldest and most authentic establishments — for conference-goers to come hang out after the tutorials wrap up!)
@doughellmann Thanks
http://www.manuelstavern.com
I'd love to check this place out.

This is my first time to PyCon and my plan is to intrude on everything I possibly can, hope not to annoy people, and meet as many cool / interesting people as possible :) I'd love to head out to this event but I'd need a ride unless Manuel's is accessible by MARTA
@sontek hooray :D
@jrothenbuhler you staying at the conference hotel?
Ah, the magic of MARTA — turning a 7-minute drive a few blocks away into an epic hour-long series of bus rides.  (Thanks for the link, though, in case someone needs it!)
@alfredchiesa yep, I'm at the Hyatt
Yeah, I'm willing to make a couple trips to help people avoid that ride :P
Public transit directions from Hyatt to Manuel's http://is.gd/J1PQ7z
What's the best way for those of us looking for rides to connect with those offering them? Maybe the drivers could post their departure time and location?
@brandon_rhodes to be fair, it's great if you're trying to get to The Brick Store ;-)
@brandon_rhodes I'll have to see how volunteer efforts shape up, but I'd love to ride-along!

@gthank Agreed!  If only the Brick Store had room for us. :-)  @wolever That might work! In a few years we will probably laugh when we remember having to organize things like this in a chat room, rather than just tapping a few keys on our wristband RideOrganizr app and getting picked up at the front of the hotel.
I'd like to go assuming that a) my flight is reasonably on-time and b) I can share a car/cab with someone. What's a good way to coordinate at the Hyatt?
If it's only a seven-minute ride then I imagine cab sharing would be a practical way to add guests above the limits of transport available from those going.
Sounds awesome. Would love to come if I get in in time
How about if we meet in the lobby (at the same level as the registration desk) around 7:00?
@brandon_rhodes - I def. need a "PyMag Editors" pic w/ you, @doughellmann and myself sometime before the conference ends.
man, I'd love to be counted in for this, @brandon_rhodes
@jonesy Then consider yourself counted!
@brandon_rhodes r0ck! See you there!
Alas, I have been pressed into a PSF-related meeting or I would also be joining in.
I can play a homeless man pretty impressively
just give me some tattered rags
@holdenweb We could hire a homeless man to go in your place so you could make it to manuels
my flight gets in around 6, so this could work out smashingly
@doughellmann  the lobby at 19:00 sounds good to me.
How late will you guys be staying?  I'll be driving down from Chattanooga and probably won't get in until 10:30pm or so...
I would be happy to come on Thursday!
This sounds great! Brandon and Doug I owe a beer to for infinite patience with a long-delayed Python Mag article from long, long ago. :-)
@sontek Nice idea, but I suspect the sponsors would twih teh homeless man wasn't the PSF chairman. Or maybe not ...
so meeting in the lobby at 7, sounds great.
Oooh, is it too late to get in on the social? As long as flights stay close to on time would like to join in.
I'm not sure I'll be there on time but I'll love to tag alone. However I think I'll arrive later than 7pm to the hotel

I think I'll not get through immigration that fast (anyone have experience of using ATL as port of entry? I'm entering under the visa waiver program...), but I might hang around in the bar when you return...
@brandon_rhodes I'm a little late to the party (and won't have a car), but I'd love to come along for this if there's still room!

I have updated our Python Atlanta March meeting description on Meetup.com to reflect all of the new plans! http://www.meetup.com/python-atlanta/events/16627017/ Again, people who want rides can gather just before 7pm Thursday in the front lobby of the Hyatt by the revolving doors. If interested parties could add their names to this thread, we can try to make sure we have enough vehicles.  Again, I can carry 6 or 7!  Other drivers should check in to on this thread so that we can assemble an account of how many seats we are offering in total.
Myself and my room mate are looking to come if planes stay on time. Rick Harding & Jorge Vargas.
@mitechie  lol I just came here to say that BTW me = Jorge Vargas
@mattg Thats cheating, you have 2 first names.
@sontek I can always bring out my middle name and have 3
I'm in. Matt George
<-- Jake Rothenbuhler, I was hoping to come
Nice idea, count me in. 7pm at Hyatt
I'll be looking for a ride… I'm @wolever ;)
I am in and have room for 2-3 people if anyone needs a ride.
I can fit 4, 3 in the back, 1 up front if anyone needs a ride.
i shall be joining as well.
We should be arriving around then. I hope to make it though. Thanks for organizing!
I have place for 3-4 more to PyAtl (and back!). I'll be by registration or on the main floor. Jay Kelkar
MARTA bus #16 goes from the hotel at Peachtree center to within 1 block of Manuel's Tavern. http://www.itsmarta.com/16-w.aspx Google Maps w/bus route http://is.gd/1cyllA
Thank you, @steve_piercy, that will help a LOT in case there are not enough cars!
I have my car and can take 2 others comfortably -- I'll be around the lobby @7
Is there parking at the tavern?  I'm from Athens and will be driving home after.
If there are any late departures to this -- my flight comes in at 7:30, I think -- I'd love to tag along once I've checked in.
All right, odds are pretty poor of me making the hotel by 9:30. I guess the rest of the weekend will have to do.
@mennis Yes, there's parking behind and next to the tavern.
If anyone is keeping track of rides, somewhere between 0 and 3 of my friends might want to come too.
does anyone going to manuel's tavern have 2 vacant seats?
anyone going by cab? or public transport? :)
I plan on taking public transport. Might volunteer first with taping down stuff, then wander out to the hotel lobby and leave by 6:45pm.
I'll wait till 7pm to see if i can get a ride. Else, I'll take a ride with "ms. Marta"
Cab price should be <$15 from the hotel to Manuel's.
@steve_piercy woah... you kidding?
Great.  I have a car that can seat 3 others but I'm not planning coming back to the hotel.
I can pick some people up but I'm getting tore up once I reach Manuel's and I never ferry people when I drive drunk.
@GhettoCode nice. did not know that. glad I got my breeze card.
@jamespaxi no kidding. typical for transit service frequency to decrease during the evening

Also return times: http://www.itsmarta.com/16-w.aspx HiPo is nearest Manuel's and JWCo is nearest the hotel. Return times from HiPo/Manuel's: 08:39p, 09:24p, 10:09p, 10:54p, 11:34p. Default return by cab.
if you bought a breeze card: free
Note: if you miss the 7:03pm #16 from Peachtree, then you must wait 45 minutes for the next one, else take 2 buses. http://is.gd/1cyllA
How's the cab price compare to bus when split 2-3 ways?
cab: $10.20. http://www.taxifarefinder.com/main.php?city=Atlanta
Steve: don't forget atlanta cabs charge an extra $2 per passenger.  Yup, not kidding.
@GhettoCode nice
hey guys, so down in lobby around 6:30-7pm? I gotta catch some sleep... or I'll pass out later :P
Manuel's tends to have plenty of parking — a big lot sits right south of the building, and should still have spaces in the 7–8pm slot.

Hey, everyone!  I am planning to station someone in the lobby who will know my phone number, so that if there are still people without rides once the fleet of cars has made its first run to Manuel's, they can call me and I (and maybe one or two other drivers, depending on demand?) can drive the two miles back to the hotel to pick up a second group.
Hows the parking at Manuels?
any hot babes going?
Thanks steve! ;-)
Not too hard. Ask the restaurant to call for one.

Hi all! I plan to get in on this mess and will be down in the lobby around 7. I can expense a cab ride so I don't mind springing for that and I can take some folks with me. How feasible will it be to get a cab back though?
I'll be in the lobby for 7 either seeking a lift or people to share a cab with. Liz
@kongdontift I'll put on my heels for you.

just FYI, If you don't wanna or can't make it to Manuel's Thursday night is Mai Tai night at Trader Vic's in the Hilton just a couple of blocks from the Hyatt. And yeah everybody's hair will be perfect.
We are here with about 6 people anyone near that want to take a cab?
I don't see a group of pycon people. Is everyone gone already?
we are at the. Concierge right now
Hi, we are two that would like to share a cab to the tavern. Well be at the concierge in 5 min. Two tall guys.
I had problems with my baggage, so I'm arriving later than expected. Anyone still around the hotel that wants to share a cab? (or someone who can give a ride?)
Leaving hyatt in 5 minutes anyone still need a ride?
@mennis still offering?
Ok, I'm going to be grabbing a cab in 10 if anyone wants to share
I'll be in the lobby, blue shirt, green t-shirt, black and yellow jacket.
@wolever if you're still at the hotel I'd love to share a cab.

I have just returned home from the successful social at Manuel's Tavern, and want to thank everyone involved — especially the several local members who showed up in their automobiles to give rides to our out-of-town guests at PyCon!  Everyone seems to have had a great time.  Have a great PyCon, everyone, and I will see you bright and early tomorrow!
Wish I could have been there!
just stumbled back to the hotel, and had a great time with some locals from pyatl. Thanks to our gracious hosts for arranging the meeting spot. Good food, good beverages, good people.
